title: Avoid these five risk factors and live longer, study says
description: How would you like to add seven to 10 healthy, disease-free years to your life as you age?

title: See Australian fires from the sky
description: CNN's Anna Coren gets an exclusive view of the fires raging in Australia, as firefighters use helicopters to battle the massive fires threatening the country.

title: And the most admired man in America is...
description: Every year, Gallup asks Americans who they admire the most. In 2019, it was a tie -- between two men who are about as different as can be.

title: 'Ugly Betty' creator dies at 45
description: Silvio Horta, who created the hit ABC television series "Ugly Betty," has died at 45, according to a family statement.

title: Conjoined twins successfully separated by 78-member team
description: Two sisters, who were joined in the chest and abdomen, have been successfully separated in a surgery by a 78-member team in Nigeria's capital, Abuja.

title: Carnival Cruise Line bans 'offensive clothing'
description: Think your profanity-laced T-shirt would be fun to wear on your next cruise?

title: 'OITNB' star giving up green card to fight climate change
description: "Orange is the New Black" actress Yael Stone has said she is giving up her US green card and returning to her home country of Australia in order to reduce her carbon footprint.

title: Carlos Ghosn to make first major public appearance since escaping Japan
description: Carlos Ghosn is ready to tell his side of the story.

title: Iran calls attacks 'proportionate measures in self-defense'
description: Iran fired a number of missiles at two Iraqi bases housing US troops Wednesday in retaliation for the American strike that killed a top Iranian general last week. The early morning attack presents President Donald Trump with the biggest test of his presidency to date.

title: World's first 350km-per-hour driverless bullet train goes into service in China
description: China has just hurtled past another milestone in its vast high-speed railway expansion plans.

title: Iran's strikes seem intended to avoid US deaths
description: Iran's missile strikes against bases in Iraq housing American troops early Wednesday were not an act designed to kill the most Americans possible.

title: Passengers onboard crashed plane in Iran hailed from around the world
description: The 176 victims onboard the Ukraine International Airlines flight that crashed after takeoff from Tehran on Wednesday hailed from various countries around the world.

title: The Boeing 737 jet took off with 167 passengers and nine crew on board
description: All 176 people on board a Ukraine International Airlines flight were killed when it crashed shortly after takeoff from Imam Khomeini Airport in Tehran, the country's Press TV reported.

title: Sadio Mane crowned Africa's best footballer having emerged as Liverpool's key man
description: Mo Salah is often viewed as the central protagonist to Liverpool's recent rise, with fellow forward Sadio Mane providing a quiet, industrial presence at the Egyptian's side.

title: Duke and Duchess of Sussex drop by Canada House in London to thank officials for hospitality
description: Prince Harry and his wife Meghan, Duchess of Sussex, dropped by Canada House in London on Tuesday to thank officials for the hospitality shown to them on their holiday in Canada.

title: No known casualties after Iran fired ballistic missiles at US forces in Iraq, sources say
Malaga coach Victor Sanchez suspended over explicit video, says he is victim of 'harassment and extortion'
description: Spanish soccer club Malaga has suspended head coach Victor Sanchez after an explicit video of him appeared on social media.

title: New Project Centauro superyacht concept resembles a spaceship
description: With so many inventive superyachts in the works, coming up with a bold and innovative is proving harder and harder for top designers.

title: The world's tallest hotel to open in Dubai...again
description: In 2018, the 356-meter (1,168 feet) Gevora Hotel in Dubai became the tallest hotel in the world, complete with certification as a Guinness World Record.

title: Trump faces choice after Iran attack: To escalate or not
description: Iran's defiant volley of ballistic missile attacks on Iraqi bases hosting American forces significantly quickened a cycle of escalation that threatens to erupt into a full blown war with the United States.

title: Fires, storms and floods cost $150 billion in 2019. More disasters are on the way
description: Hurricanes, wildfires and floods cost the world $150 billion in 2019 and losses for business and the economy are only expected to increase, because of a decade-long rise in natural catastrophes with direct links to climate change.

title: Serena Williams, Roger Federer and Rafa Nadal commit to Australian bushfires charity match
description: A number of the world's top tennis stars, including Serena Williams, Roger Federer and Rafa Nadal, have agreed to play in an exhibition match to raise funds for Australia's bushfire relief.

title: How Chicago became America's brashest and boldest city
description: Nicknamed the "city of the broad shoulders," Chicago rises majestically out of America's Midwest.

title: Puerto Rico residents sleeping outside as aftershocks rattle a region on edge after deadly earthquake
description: Puerto Rico residents spent the night outside as aftershocks rocked the region following a magnitude 6.4 earthquake that knocked out power and water services in some areas.

title: Toyota is building a 'smart' city to test AI, robots and self-driving cars
description: Carmaker Toyota has unveiled plans for a 2,000-person "city of the future," where it will test autonomous vehicles, smart technology and robot-assisted living.

title: See wreckage of the Ukraine International Airlines crash in Iran
description: A Kiev-bound Ukraine International Airlines Boeing 737 plane crashed after takeoff from Tehran, killing all 176 people on board. The airline has suspended its flights to Tehran until further notice.

title: China bans foreign teaching materials in public schools
description: China has announced a ban on foreign teaching materials like textbooks and classic novels in all public primary and secondary schools -- a move experts say is an attempt to tighten ideological control of students across the country.

title: 24 people charged with deliberately setting bushfires in Australia
Late-night throw shade on Bolton's possible testimony
description: Late-night hosts Stephen Colbert and Trevor Noah weigh in on former Trump National Security Adviser John Bolton saying he was prepared to testify if the Senate issued a subpoena for his testimony in the President's impeachment trial.

title: Four men ordered to hang for deadly gang rape on bus
description: Four men have been issued with death warrants for the brutal gang rape of a 23-year-old physiotherapy student in New Delhi more than seven years ago.

title: A look at the most significant weapons in the US military arsenal
description: With almost 3 million service members, 4,800 defense sites on seven continents and an annual budget of more than $700 billion, the US military is considered the world's premier fighting force.

title: Republican senator has a warning for Iranians
description: Sen. Lindsey Graham (R-SC) appeared on Fox News saying that the Iranian attack on the Iraqi base that houses US military personnel was "an act of war" and that President Donald Trump had all the authority needed to retaliate.

title: Impeachment festers as Washington eyes war
description: Washington (rightfully) continues to be focused on potential war with Iran after President Donald Trump authorized the killing of the country's top general, who the US long ago designated as a terrorist.

title: Body of Qasem Soleimani to be laid to rest in hometown
description: Iranian commander Qasem Soleimani's body will be laid to rest in his hometown Kerman, Iran. The nation retaliated for the US strike that killed the top commander with missile attacks at military bases in Iraq housing US troops. CNN's Frederik Pleitgen has the latest.

title: Trump tweets message of optimism following Iran's attacks
description: CNN's Chris Cuomo and Rep. Mike Rogers (R-AL) discuss President Donald Trump's optimistic tweet following Iran's attacks on Iraqi military bases where US troops are stationed.

title: Video appears to show missiles hit air base housing US troops
description: Video from Iran's Fars news appears to show the moment missiles land on the al-Asad air base in Iraq, which houses US troops. CNN cannot independently verify this video.

title: It's time for museums to return their stolen treasures
description: Western museums are beset with demands to give back stolen property -- the cultural heritage of oppressed people plundered by colonial armies in the 19th century or taken unfairly by grasping missionaries or egregious ambassadors.
